newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk Tupras to raise capital sharply.
newsitem.headline: Turk Tupras to raise capital sharply.

text.p: Turkey's state-run oil refiner Tupras - Turkiye Petrol Rafinerileri A.S. said it would raise its capital to 29.901 trillion lira from 4.672 trillion by issuing rights and bonus shares.
Tupras plans to issue 12.614 trillion lira of bonuses and rights each, or 2.7 right and 2.7 bonus for one existing share, the company said in a statement sent to the Istanbul Stock Exchange.
The capital increase is subject to approval by Turkey's privatisation administration OIB which holds 96.41 percent of Tupras shares as the company is included in the government's sell-off programme.
The increase must also be approved by the regulatory Capital Markets Board.
Tupras's losses surged to 18.97 trillion lira last year from five trillion in 1995.
